result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared Robert Weddle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs. Bond to be applied.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

Defendant to have no contact with S.S. 

Department of Correction may modify or lift  the no contact if the agent feels it is appropriate.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Court finds defendant indigent on count 2.

records.addlTxt: 3:56 PM ADA Mike Diaz appears in person for the state. Defendant appears in person, in custody from TC Jail. Attorney Swank appears in person. Joint recommendation presented to the court. State moves to amend count 1. Court grants amendment of count 1. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant enters NC plea to amended count 1 and count 2. Court finds defendant G of amended count 1 and count 2. Defendant sentenced.

3:18 PM Defendant Jared Robert Weddle not in court.  Attorney Lucas Swank appeared by video for Jared Robert Weddle.  Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advised defendant has open cases in La Crosse County with a Preliminary Hearing set for Monday, requesting any warrants be held until after that hearing. Defense advised these were set for misd. pleas. State requests WA be issued, no permanent address, two new cases in La Crosse County with same type of conduct. Court advised will not issue warrant today, if fails to appear Monday will issue warrant. PLEAS set. Bond cont.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
State requests to set at a later time due to scheduling conflict. Defense does not object. Court grants. Plea/Sentencing Hearing rescheduled from 2:30 PM to 3:15 PM.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Request for Substitution of Judge
Attorney Swank advised defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas. Request for substitution of judge. PTC set. Bond cont.

4:00 PM ADA Diaz appears in person for the state. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Swank. State calls witness, Officer/Dispatcher R. Jensen, sworn in. State examines witness. Defense examines witness. No additional questions, no additional witnesses from either party. State moves for bind over, makes argument. Defense makes argument. State makes statement. Court finds probable cause. BOT. State filed an information, counts track complaint.
